name: Test 1
subject: Intermediate Mathematics
section: Follow the directions. Show all work.

questions.answer_description: The greatest common factor of 12 and 18 is 6.
questions.question: Find the greatest common factor of 12 and 18.
questions.question_description: Find the greatest common factor of 12 and 18.

questions.answer_description: The least common multiple of 14 and 56 is 56.
questions.question: Find the least common multiple of 14 and 56.
questions.question_description: Find the least common multiple of 14 and 56.

questions.answer_description: Colin has $454 left after spending $150 on church and $396 on supplies.
questions.question: Colin's grandparents sent him a check for $1,000. He gave $150 to his church, and he spent $396 on school clothes, books, and supplies. How much of the money does he have left?
questions.question_description: Calculate the remaining money after spending $150 and $396 from $1,000.

questions.answer_description: Jeremy's car can travel 512 miles on 16 gallons of gasoline.
questions.question: Jeremy's car can travel 32 miles per gallon of gasoline. How many miles can he travel on 16 gallons of gas?
questions.question_description: Calculate the total miles Jeremy can travel on 16 gallons of gasoline.

questions.question: Megan made 3 1/3 pounds of fudge. She divided it into bags with 2/3 of a pound in each bag. How many bags of fudge did she make?
questions.question_description: Calculate the number of bags Megan can make with 3 1/3 pounds of fudge, dividing each bag into 2/3 pound.
